title: Country singer Ned LeDoux's two-year-old daughter chokes to death
text:
Country singer-songwriter Ned LeDoux's two-year-old daughter Haven choked to death at the family's home in northeast Kansas.

LeDoux and his wife of 11 years, Morgan, shared the heartbreaking news on Sunday, one week after Haven's death.

'It is with great sadness that Ned & Morgan inform friends and fans that their two year old daughter Haven passed away on October 20th due to a tragic choking accident in the home,' a post on LeDoux's Facebook page said.

'The LeDoux family appreciates your love and support and is requesting privacy at this time.'

Country singer Ned LeDoux's two-year-old daughter Haven choked to death at their family's home in Kansas on October 20. The pair are seen together in an Instagram post from July

Haven had just celebrated her second birthday last month. 'Turned the big #2 today! Happy to be home for this special day. What a character this one,' LeDoux wrote in an Instagram post from the toddler's birthday party (pictured)

LeDoux and his wife of 11 years, Morgan, shared the heartbreaking news on Sunday

The social media statement originally read: 'Paramedics were called to the family's northeast Kansas home on October 20th and arrived quickly, but attempts to resuscitate her were unsuccessful,' according to Taste of Country.

Additional details about the accident have not been released.

Haven had just celebrated her second birthday last month.

'Turned the big #2 today! Happy to be home for this special day. What a character this one,' her father wrote in an Instagram post from her birthday party.

Ned and Morgan are also parents to a son named Branson. They live at the home Morgan where Morgan grew up in Emmett.

LeDoux released his debut album Sagebrush in 2017 and is expected to release another album, Next In Line, in November.

He is the son of country singer-songwriter and radio champion Chris LeDoux, who died in 2005 after a battle with cancer.

The younger LeDoux, who was raised in Wyoming, got his start in music playing the drums for his father's band, Western Underground, in 1998.

The singer and his wife of 11 years, Morgan, announced Haven's passing on Sunday

LeDoux released his debut album Sagebrush in 2017 and is expected to release another album, Next In Line, in November. The singer is pictured in November 2017

Ned and Morgan are seen with their daughter Haven and son Branson last Thanksgiving

Haven's death came a few months after fellow country singer Granger Smith lost his three-year-old son River to a drowning accident at their family's Texas home in June of this year.

'Riv was special. Everyone that met him knew that immediately,' Smith wrote in a Facebook post about River's tragic death.

'The joy he brought to our lives cannot be expressed and his light will be forever in our hearts. If there are words to say more, I cannot find them in this moment.

'Love the ones close to you. There has never been a more difficult moment for us than this.'
description: Ned LeDoux, 43, and his wife of 11 years, Morgan, shared the heartbreaking news about their daughter Haven's passing on Sunday, one week after the choking accident.
